qas.question: By what year did the Qin armies finish their conquest of Shu and Ba?
What did Qin administrators introduce to Shu and Ba?
Who engineered the Dujiangyan irrigation system to control the Min River?
The Min River is a major tributary of what river?
The Dujiangyan irrigation system was used for what purpose?

answers.text: to either provide irrigation or prevent floods.

qas.question: Who began their conquest of Shu and Ba in 316 BC?

plausible_answers.text: written records and civil achievements of earlier kingdoms

qas.question: What was preserved during the Qin conquest?
Who tried to control the Yangtze river?
What was built to control the Yangtze river?
The Yantze is a major tributary of what river?
By what year did the Quin armies finish their conquest of Yangtze?
What did Qin administrators introduce to Yangtze?
Who engineered the Dujangyan irrigation sytem to control China?
The Qin River is a major tributary of what river?
The Min irrigation system was used for what purpose?

context: <b5_0>Qin armies<b5_0/> finished their conquest of the kingdoms of Shu and Ba by <a0_0><b10_0>316 BC<b10_0/><a0_0/>. Any <b6_0>written records and civil achievements of earlier kingdoms<b6_0/> were destroyed. Qin administrators introduced <a1_0><b11_0>improved agricultural technology<b11_0/>.<a1_0/> <a2_0><b7_0><b12_0>Li Bing<b12_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/>, engineered the <b8_0>Dujiangyan irrigation system<b8_0/> to control the <b9_0>Min<b9_0/> River, a major tributary of the <a3_0><b13_0>Yangtze<b13_0/><a3_0/>. This innovative hydraulic system was composed of movable weirs which could be adjusted for high or low water flow according to the season, <a4_0>to either <b14_0>provide irrigation or prevent floods<b14_0/>.<a4_0/> The increased agricultural output and taxes made the area a source of provisions and men for Qin's unification of China.
